revisions.*: Because "rvslots" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used.

{{Taxobox | image = Coprinopsis picacea 12184.jpg | image_width = 235px | image_caption = | regnum = [[Fungus|Fungi]] | phylum = [[Basidiomycota]] | classis = [[Agaricomycetes]] | ordo = [[Agaricales]] | familia = [[Psathyrellaceae]] | genus = ''[[Coprinopsis]]'' | species = '''''C. picacea''''' | binomial = ''Coprinopsis picacea'' | binomial_authority = ([[Jean Baptiste François Pierre Bulliard|Bull.]]) Redhead, Vilgalys & Moncalvo | synonyms_ref = | synonyms = ''Agaricus picaceus'' Bull.
''Coprinus picaceus'' (Bull.) [[Samuel Frederick Gray|Gray]] }} {{mycomorphbox | name = ''Coprinopsis picacea'' | whichGills = free | capShape = conical | hymeniumType=gills | stipeCharacter=bare | ecologicalType=saprotrophic | sporePrintColor=black | howEdible = poisonous }} '''''Coprinopsis picacea''''' is a species of [[fungus]] in the [[Psathyrellaceae]]. It is commonly called '''magpie fungus'''. It is native to Britain. It was first described in 1785 by French mycologist [[Jean Baptiste François Pierre Bulliard]] in 1785 as ''Agaricus picaceus''. This poisonous species can sometimes be confused with the edible ''[[Coprinus comatus]]''. ==See also== {{Portal|Fungi}} *[[List of Coprinopsis species|List of ''Coprinopsis'' species]] ==References== {{Reflist|refs= {{cite book |author=Bulliard JBF. |year=1785 |title=Herbier de la France |trans-title=Guide to the Herbs of France |volume=5 |pages=192–240 |language=French}} }} {{Taxonbar|from=Q779716}} [[Category:Coprinopsis|picacea]] [[Category:Fungi of Europe]] [[Category:Fungi of North America]] [[Category:Fungi described in 1785]] {{Agaricales-stub}}
